title: JSON Schema for Beef Entity code-generation (https://github.com/Avanade/Beef).

refDataNamespace.title: The namespace for the Reference Data entities (adds as a c# `using` statement) where the `Entity.EntityScope` property configuration is `Common`.

refDataText.title: Indicates whether a corresponding `Text` property is added when generating a Reference Data `Property` for an `Entity`.
refDataText.description: This is used where serializing within the Web API `Controller` and the `ExecutionContext.IsRefDataTextSerializationEnabled` is set to `true` (which is automatically set where the url contains `$text=true`).

refDataWebApiRoute.title: The `RouteAtttribute` for the Reference Data Web API controller required for named pre-fetching.

refDataCache.title: The cache used for the ReferenceData providers.
refDataCache.description: Defaults to `ReferenceDataCache`. A value of `ReferenceDataCache` specifies a single-tenant cache; otherwise, `ReferenceDataMultiTenantCache` for a multi-tenant cache leverageing the `ExecutionContext.TenantId`.

refDataAppendToNamespace.title: The Reference Data entity namespace appended to end of the standard `company.appname.Common.Entities.{AppendToNamespace}`.
refDataAppendToNamespace.description: Defaults to `null`; being nothing to append.

refDataBusNamespace.title: The namespace for the Reference Data entities (adds as a c# `using` statement) where the `Entity.EntityScope` property configuration is `Business`.

jsonSerializer.title: The JSON Serializer to use for JSON property attribution.
jsonSerializer.description: Defaults to `Newtonsoft`. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

entityUsing.title: The namespace for the non Reference Data entities (adds as a c# <c>using</c> statement).
entityUsing.description: Defaults to `Common` which will add `.Common.Entities`. Otherwise, `Business` to add `.Business.Entities`, `All` to add both, and `None` to exclude any.

usingNamespace1.title: The additional Namespace using statement to the added to the generated `Entity` code.
usingNamespace1.description: Typically used where referening a `Type` from a Namespace that is not generated by default.

usingNamespace2.title: The additional Namespace using statement to the added to the generated `Entity` code.
usingNamespace2.description: Typically used where referening a `Type` from a Namespace that is not generated by default.

usingNamespace3.title: The additional Namespace using statement to the added to the generated `Entity` code.
usingNamespace3.description: Typically used where referening a `Type` from a Namespace that is not generated by default.

webApiAuthorize.title: The authorize attribute value to be used for the corresponding entity Web API controller; generally either `Authorize` or `AllowAnonymous`.
webApiAuthorize.description: This can be overidden within the `Entity`(s) and/or their corresponding `Operation`(s).

appBasedAgentArgs.title: Indicates whether to create and use a domain-specific `WebApi.WebApiAgentArgs` to simplify dependency injection usage.

validatorLayer.title: The namespace for the Reference Data entities (adds as a c# `using` statement).
validatorLayer.description: Defaults to `Business`. A value of `Business` indicates that the Validators will be defined within the `Business` namespace/assembly; otherwise, defined within the `Common` namespace/assembly.

databaseName.title: The .NET database interface name (used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Database`).
databaseName.description: Defaults to `IDatabase`. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

entityFrameworkName.title: The .NET Entity Framework interface name used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `EntityFramework`.
entityFrameworkName.description: Defaults to `IEfDb`. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

cosmosName.title: The .NET Entity Framework interface name used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.
cosmosName.description: Defaults to `ICosmosDb`. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

odataName.title: The .NET OData interface name used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `OData`.
odataName.description: Defaults to `IOData`. This can be overridden within the `Entity`(s).

refDataDefaultMapperConverter.title: The default Reference Data property `Converter` used by the generated `Mapper`(s) where not specifically defined.

dataUsingNamespace.title: The additional Namespace using statement to the added to the generated `Data` code.

databaseUsingNamespace.title: The additional Namespace using statement to the added to the generated `Data` code where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Database`.

entityFrameworkUsingNamespace.title: The additional Namespace using statement to the added to the generated `Data` code where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `EntityFramework`.

cosmosUsingNamespace.title: additional Namespace using statement to the added to the generated `Data` code where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.

odataUsingNamespace.title: additional Namespace using statement to the added to the generated `Data` code where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `OData`.

eventPublish.title: Indicates whether to add logic to publish an event on the successful completion of the `DataSvc` layer invocation for a `Create`, `Update` or `Delete` operation.
eventPublish.description: Defaults to `true`. Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventHub, Service Broker, SignalR, etc. This can be overidden within the `Entity`(s).

eventSubjectRoot.title: The root for the event name by prepending to all event subject names.
eventSubjectRoot.description: Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventHub, Service Broker, SignalR, etc. This can be overidden within the `Entity`(s).

eventActionFormat.title: The formatting for the Action when an Event is published.

grpc.title: Indicates whether gRPC support (more specifically service-side) is required.
grpc.description: gRPC support is an explicit opt-in model. Must be set to `true` for any of the subordinate gRPC capabilities to be code-generated. Will require each `Entity`, and corresponding `Property` and `Operation` to be opted-in specifically.

pathCommon.title: The path (directory) for the Database-related artefacts.
pathCommon.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter) + `.Common` (literal). For example `Beef.Demo.Common`.

pathBusiness.title: The path (directory) for the Business-related (.NET) artefacts.
pathBusiness.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter) + `.Business` (literal). For example `Beef.Demo.Business`.

pathApi.title: The path (directory) for the API-related (.NET) artefacts.
pathApi.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter) + `` + `ApiName` (runtime parameter). For example `Beef.Demo.Api`.

namespaceCommon.title: The root Namespace for the Common-related (.NET) artefacts.
namespaceCommon.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter) + `.Common` (literal). For example `Beef.Demo.Common`.

namespaceBusiness.title: The root Namespace for the Business-related (.NET) artefacts.
namespaceBusiness.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter) + `.Business` (literal). For example `Beef.Demo.Business`.

namespaceApi.title: The root Namespace for the Api-related (.NET) artefacts.
namespaceApi.description: Defaults to `Company` (runtime parameter) + `.` + `AppName` (runtime parameter) + `` + `ApiName` (runtime parameter). For example `Beef.Demo.Api`.

text.title: The overriding text for use in comments.
text.description: Overrides the Name (as sentence text) for the summary comments. It will be formatted as: `Represents the {Text} entity.`. To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. {{Xxx}}).

fileName.title: The overriding file name.
fileName.description: Overrides the Name as the code-generated file name.

entityScope.title: The entity scope option.
entityScope.description: Determines whether the entity is considered `Common` (default) or should be scoped to the `Business` namespace/assembly only (i.e. not externally visible).

privateName.title: The overriding private name.
privateName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for private fields. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `_firstName`.

argumentName.title: The overriding argument name.
argumentName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for argument parameters. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `firstName`.

constType.title: The Const .NET Type option.
constType.description: The .NET Type to be used for the `const` values. Defaults to `string`.

isInitialOverride.title: Indicates whether to override the `ICleanup.IsInitial` property.
isInitialOverride.description: Set to either `true` or `false` to override as specified; otherwise, `null` to check each property. Defaults to `null`.

refDataType.title: The Reference Data identifier Type option.
refDataType.description: Required to identify an entity as being Reference Data. Specifies the underlying .NET Type used for the Reference Data identifier.

refDataText.title: Indicates whether a corresponding `Text` property is added when generating a Reference Data `Property` overriding the `CodeGeneration.RefDataText` selection.
refDataText.description: This is used where serializing within the Web API`Controller` and the `ExecutionContext.IsRefDataTextSerializationEnabled` is set to `true` (which is automatically set where the url contains `$text=true`).

refDataSortOrder.title: The Reference Data sort order option.
refDataSortOrder.description: Specifies the default sort order for the underlying Reference Data collection. Defaults to `SortOrder`.

refDataStringFormat.title: The Reference Data `ToString` composite format.
refDataStringFormat.description: The string format supports the standard composite formatting; where the following indexes are used: `{0}` for `Id`, `{1}` for `Code` and `{2}` for `Text`. Defaults to `{2}`.

inherits.title: The base class that the entity inherits from.
inherits.description: Defaults to `EntityBase` for a standard entity. For Reference Data it will default to `ReferenceDataBaseInt` or `ReferenceDataBaseGuid` depending on the corresponding `RefDataType` value. See `OmitEntityBase` if the desired outcome is to not inherit from any of the aforementioned base classes.

implements.title: The list of comma separated interfaces that are to be declared for the entity class.

autoInferImplements.title: Indicates whether to automatically infer the interface implements for the entity from the properties declared.
autoInferImplements.description: Will attempt to infer the following: `IGuidIdentifier`, `IIntIdentifier`, `IStringIdentifier`, `IETag` and `IChangeLog`. Defaults to `true`.

abstract.title: Indicates whether the class should be defined as abstract.

genericWithT.title: Indicates whether the class should be defined as a generic with a single parameter `T`.

namespace.title: The entity namespace to be appended.
namespace.description: Appended to the end of the standard structure as follows: `{Company}.{AppName}.Common.Entities.{Namespace}`.

omitEntityBase.title: Indicates that the entity should not inherit from `EntityBase`.
omitEntityBase.description: As such any of the `EntityBase` related capabilites are not supported (are omitted from generation). The intention for this is more for the generation of simple internal entities.

jsonSerializer.title: The JSON Serializer to use for JSON property attribution.
jsonSerializer.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.JsonSerializer` configuration property where specified; otherwise, `Newtonsoft`.

collection.title: Indicates whether a corresponding entity collection class should be created.

collectionResult.title: Indicates whether a corresponding entity collection result class should be created
collectionResult.description: Enables the likes of additional paging state to be stored with the underlying collection.

collectionKeyed.title: Indicates whether the entity collection is keyed using the properties defined as forming part of the unique key.

collectionInherits.title: The base class that a `Collection` inherits from.
collectionInherits.description: Defaults to `EntityBaseCollection` or `EntityBaseKeyedCollection` depending on `CollectionKeyed`. For Reference Data it will default to `ReferenceDataCollectionBase`.

collectionResultInherits.title: The base class that a `CollectionResult` inherits from.

validator.title: The name of the .NET `Type` that will perform the validation.
validator.description: Only used for `Create` and `Update` operation types (`Operation.Type`) where not specified explicitly.

get.title: Indicates that a `Get` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

getAll.title: Indicates that a `GetAll` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

create.title: Indicates that a `Create` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

update.title: Indicates that a `Update` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

patch.title: Indicates that a `Patch` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

delete.title: Indicates that a `Delete` operation will be automatically generated where not otherwise explicitly specified.

autoImplement.title: The data source auto-implementation option.
autoImplement.description: Defaults to `None`. Indicates that the implementation for the underlying `Operations` will be auto-implemented using the selected data source (unless explicity overridden). When selected some of the related attributes will also be required (as documented). Additionally, the `AutoImplement` indicator must be selected for each underlying `Operation` that is to be auto-implemented.

mapperAddStandardProperties.title: Indicates that the `AddStandardProperties` method call is to be included for the generated (corresponding) `Mapper`.

dataConstructor.title: The access modifier for the generated `Data` constructor.

dataExtensions.title: Indicates whether the `Data` extensions logic should be generated.

databaseName.title: The .NET database interface name (used where `AutoImplement` is `Database`).
databaseName.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.DatabaseName` configuration property (its default value is `IDatabase`).

databaseSchema.title: The database schema name (used where `AutoImplement` is `Database`).

databaseMapperInheritsFrom.title: The name of the `Mapper` that the generated Database `Mapper` inherits from.

databaseCustomerMapper.title: Indicates that a custom Database `Mapper` will be used; i.e. not generated.
databaseCustomerMapper.description: Otherwise, by default, a `Mapper` will be generated.

entityFrameworkName.title: The .NET Entity Framework interface name used where `AutoImplement` is `EntityFramework`.
entityFrameworkName.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.EntityFrameworkName` configuration property (its default value is `IEfDb`).

entityFrameworkModel.title: The corresponding Entity Framework model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `EntityFramework`).

entityFrameworkMapperInheritsFrom.title: The name of the `Mapper  that the generated Entity Framework `Mapper` inherits from.
entityFrameworkMapperInheritsFrom.description: Defaults to `Model.{Name}`; i.e. an entity with the same name in the `Model` namespace.

entityFrameworkCustomMapper.title: Indicates that a custom Entity Framework `Mapper` will be used; i.e. not generated.
entityFrameworkCustomMapper.description: Otherwise, by default, a `Mapper` will be generated.

cosmosName.title: The .NET Cosmos interface name used where `AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.
cosmosName.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.CosmosName` configuration property (its default value is `ICosmosDb`).

cosmosModel.title: The corresponding Cosmos model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`).

cosmosPartitionKey.title: The C# code to be used for setting the optional Cosmos `PartitionKey` where `AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.

cosmosValueContainer.title: Indicates whether the `CosmosDbValueContainer` is to be used; otherwise, `CosmosDbContainer`.

cosmosMapperInheritsFrom.title: The name of the `Mapper` that the generated Cosmos `Mapper` inherits from.

cosmosCustomMapper.title: Indicates that a custom Cosmos `Mapper` will be used; i.e. not generated.
cosmosCustomMapper.description: Otherwise, by default, a `Mapper` will be generated.

odataName.title: The .NET OData interface name used where `AutoImplement` is `OData`.
odataName.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.ODataName` configuration property (its default value is `IOData`).

odataModel.title: The corresponding OData model name (required where `AutoImplement` is `OData`).

odataCollectionName.title: The name of the underlying OData collection where `AutoImplement` is `OData`.
odataCollectionName.description: The underlying `Simple.OData.Client` will attempt to infer.

odataMapperInheritsFrom.title: The name of the `Mapper` that the generated OData `Mapper` inherits from.

odataCustomMapper.title: Indicates that a custom OData `Mapper` will be used; i.e. not generated.
odataCustomMapper.description: Otherwise, by default, a `Mapper` will be generated.

dataSvcCaching.title: Indicates whether request-based `IRequestCache` caching is to be performed at the `DataSvc` layer to improve performance (i.e. reduce chattiness).

eventPublish.title: Indicates whether to add logic to publish an event on the successful completion of the `DataSvc` layer invocation for a `Create`, `Update` or `Delete` operation.
eventPublish.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.EventPublish` configuration property (inherits) where not specified. Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventGrid, Service Broker, SignalR, etc.

dataSvcConstructor.title: The access modifier for the generated `DataSvc` constructor.

dataSvcExtensions.title: Indicates whether the `DataSvc` extensions logic should be generated.

managerConstructor.title: The access modifier for the generated `Manager` constructor.

managerExtensions.title: Indicates whether the `Manager` extensions logic should be generated.

webApiRoutePrefix.title: The `RoutePrefixAtttribute` for the corresponding entity Web API controller.
webApiRoutePrefix.description: This is the base (prefix) `URI` for the entity and can be further extended when defining the underlying `Operation`(s).

webApiAuthorize.title: The authorize attribute value to be used for the corresponding entity Web API controller; generally either `Authorize` or `AllowAnonymous`.
webApiAuthorize.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.WebApiAuthorize` configuration property (inherits) where not specified; can be overridden at the `Operation` level also.

webApiConstructor.title: The access modifier for the generated Web API `Controller` constructor.

dataModel.title: Indicates whether a data `model` version of the entity should also be generated (output to `.\Business\Data\Model`).
dataModel.description: The model will be generated with `OmitEntityBase = true`. Any reference data properties will be defined using their `RefDataType` intrinsic `Type` versus their corresponding (actual) reference data `Type`.

excludeEntity.title: The option to exclude the generation of the `Entity` class (`Xxx.cs`).

excludeAll.title: The option to exclude the generation of all `Operation` related artefacts; excluding the `Entity` class.
excludeAll.description: Is a shorthand means for setting all of the other `Exclude*` properties (with the exception of `ExcludeEntity`) to `Yes`.

excludeIData.title: The option to exclude the generation of the `Data` interface (`IXxxData.cs`).

excludeData.title: The option to exclude the generation of the `Data` class (`XxxData.cs`).
excludeData.description: Defaults to `No` indicating _not_ to exlude. A value of `Yes` indicates to exclude all output; alternatively, `RequiresMapper` indicates to at least output the corresponding `Mapper` class.

excludeIDataSvc.title: The option to exclude the generation of the `DataSvc` interface (`IXxxDataSvc.cs`).

excludeDataSvc.title: The option to exclude the generation of the `DataSvc` class (`XxxDataSvc.cs`).

excludeIManager.title: The option to exclude the generation of the `Manager` interface (`IXxxManager.cs`).

excludeManager.title: The option to exclude the generation of the `Manager` class (`XxxManager.cs`).

excludeWebApi.title: The option to exclude the generation of the WebAPI `Controller` class (`XxxController.cs`).

excludeWebApiAgent.title: The option to exclude the generation of the WebAPI consuming `Agent` class (`XxxAgent.cs`).

excludeGrpcAgent.title: The option to exclude the generation of the gRPC consuming `Agent` class (`XxxAgent.cs`).

authRole.title: The role (permission) used by the `ExecutionContext.IsInRole(role)` for each `Operation`.
authRole.description: Used where not overridden specifically for an `Operation`; i.e. acts as the default.

grpc.title: Indicates whether gRPC support (more specifically service-side) is required for the Entity.
grpc.description: gRPC support is an explicit opt-in model (see `CodeGeneration.Grpc` configuration); therefore, each corresponding `Property` and `Operation` will also need to be opted-in specifically.

text.title: The overriding text for use in comments.
text.description: By default the `Text` will be the `Name` reformatted as sentence casing. Depending on whether the `Type` is `bool`, will appear in one of the two generated sentences. Where not `bool` it will be: Gets or sets a value indicating whether {text}.'. Otherwise, it will be: Gets or sets the {text}.'. To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. {{Xxx}}).

type.title: The .NET `Type`.
type.description: Defaults to `string`. To reference a Reference Data `Type` always prefix with `RefDataNamespace` (e.g. `RefDataNamespace.Gender`). This will ensure that the appropriate Reference Data `using` statement is used. _Shortcut:_ Where the `Type` starts with (prefix) `RefDataNamespace.` and the correspondong `RefDataType` attribute is not specified it will automatically default the `RefDataType` to `string.`

nullable.title: Indicates whether the .NET `Type` should be declared as nullable; e.g. `string?`. Will be inferred where the `Type` is denoted as nullable; i.e. suffixed by a `?`.

inherited.title: Indicates whether the property is inherited and therefore should not be output within the generated Entity class.

privateName.title: The overriding private name.
privateName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for private fields. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `_firstName`.

argumentName.title: The overriding argument name.
argumentName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for argument parameters. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `firstName`.

uniqueKey.title: Indicates whether the property is considered part of the unique (primary) key.
uniqueKey.description: This is also used to simplify the parameter specification for an Entity Operation by inferrence.

isEntity.title: Indicates that the property `Type` is another generated entity / collection and therefore specific capabilities can be assumed (e.g. `CopyFrom` and `Clone`).
isEntity.description: Will be inferred (default to `true`) where the `Type` is `ChangeLog` or the `Type` is found as another `Entity` within the code-generation configuration file.

immutable.title: Indicates that the value is immutable and therefore cannot be changed once set.

dateTimeTransform.title: The `DateTime` transformation to be performed on `Set` and `CleanUp`.
dateTimeTransform.description: Defaults to `UseDefault`. This is only applied where the `Type` is `DateTime`.

stringTrim.title: The `string` trimming of white space characters to be performed on `Set` and `CleanUp`.
stringTrim.description: Defaults to `UseDefault`. This is only applied where the `Type` is `string`.

stringTransform.title: The `string` transformation to be performed on `Set` and `CleanUp`.
stringTransform.description: Defaults to `UseDefault`. This is only applied where the `Type` is `string`.

autoCreate.title: Indicates whether an instance of the `Type` is to be automatically created/instantiated when the property is first accessed (i.e. lazy instantiation).

default.title: The C# code to default the value.
default.description: Where the `Type` is `string` then the specified default value will need to be delimited. Any valid value assignment C# code can be used.

secondaryPropertyChanged.title: The names of the secondary property(s), comma delimited, that are to be notified on a property change.

bubblePropertyChanges.title: Indicates whether the value should bubble up property changes versus only recording within the sub-entity itself.
bubblePropertyChanges.description: Note that the `IsEntity` property is also required to enable.

excludeCleanup.title: Indicates that `CleanUp` is not to be performed for the property within the `Entity.CleanUp` method.

refDataType.title: The underlying Reference Data Type that is also used as the Reference Data serialization identifier (SID).
refDataType.description: Defaults to `string` where not specified and the corresponding `Type` starts with (prefix) `RefDataNamespace.`.

refDataList.title: Indicates that the Reference Data property is to be a serializable list (`ReferenceDataSidList`).
refDataList.description: This is required to enable a list of Reference Data values (as per `RefDataType`) to be passed as an argument for example.

refDataText.title: Indicates whether a corresponding `Text` property is added when generating a Reference Data property, overriding the `Entity.RefDataText` selection.
refDataText.description: This is used where serializing within the Web API `Controller` and the `ExecutionContext.IsRefDataTextSerializationEnabled` is set to `true` (which is automatically set where the url contains `$text=true`).

refDataMapping.title: Indicates whether the property should use the underlying Reference Data mapping capabilities.
refDataMapping.description: Mapped properties are a special Reference Data property type that ensure value uniqueness; this allows the likes of additional to/from mappings to occur between systems where applicable.

jsonName.title: The JSON property name.
jsonName.description: Defaults to `ArgumentName` where not specified (i.e. camelCase).

serializationIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property is not to be serialized.
serializationIgnore.description: All properties are serialized by default.

serializationEmitDefault.title: Indicates whether to emit the default value when serializing.

dataModelJsonName.title: The override JSON property name where outputting as a data model.

dataName.title: The data name where Entity.AutoImplement is selected.
dataName.description: Defaults to the property `Name`. Represents the column name for a `Database`, or the correspinding property name for the other options.

dataConverter.title: The data `Converter` class name where `Entity.AutoImplement` is selected.
dataConverter.description: A `Converter` is used to convert a data source value to/from a .NET `Type` where no standard data conversion can be applied.

dataConverterIsGeneric.title: Indicates whether the data `Converter` is a generic class and will automatically use the corresponding property `Type` as the generic `T`.

dataMapperIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property should be ignored (excluded) from the `Data`-layer / data `Mapper` generated output.
dataMapperIgnore.description: All properties are included by default.

dataAutoGenerated.title: Indicates whether the `UniqueKey` property value is automatically generated by the data source on `Create`.

dataOperationTypes.title: The operations types (`ExecutionContext.OperationType`) selection to enable inclusion and exclusion of property mapping.

databaseMapper.title: The database property `Mapper` class name where `Entity.AutoImplement` is selected.
databaseMapper.description: A `Mapper` is used to map a data source value to/from a .NET complex `Type` (i.e. class with one or more properties).

databaseIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property should be ignored (excluded) from the database `Mapper` generated output.

entityFrameworkMapper.title: The Entity Framework property `Mapper` class name where `Entity.AutoImplement` is selected.
entityFrameworkMapper.description: A `Mapper` is used to map a data source value to/from a .NET complex `Type` (i.e. class with one or more properties).

entityFrameworkIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property should be ignored (excluded) from the Entity Framework `Mapper` generated output.

cosmosMapper.title: The Cosmos property `Mapper` class name where `Entity.AutoImplement` is selected.
cosmosMapper.description: A `Mapper` is used to map a data source value to/from a .NET complex `Type` (i.e. class with one or more properties).

cosmosIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property should be ignored (excluded) from the Cosmos `Mapper` generated output.

odataMapper.title: The OData property `Mapper` class name where `Entity.AutoImplement` is selected.
odataMapper.description: A `Mapper` is used to map a data source value to/from a .NET complex `Type` (i.e. class with one or more properties).

odataIgnore.title: Indicates whether the property should be ignored (excluded) from the OData `Mapper` generated output.

displayName.title: The display name used in the likes of error messages for the property.
displayName.description: Defaults to the `Name` as sentence case.

annotation1.title: The property annotation (e.g. attribute) declaration code.

annotation2.title: The property annotation (e.g. attribute) declaration code.

annotation3.title: The property annotation (e.g. attribute) declaration code.

webApiQueryStringConverter.title: The `IPropertyMapperConverter` to perform `Type` to `string` conversion for writing to and parsing from the query string.

grpcFieldNo.title: The unique (immutable) field number required to enable gRPC support.

grpcType.title: The underlying gRPC data type; will be inferred where not specified.

text.title: The text for use in comments.
text.description: The `Text` will be defaulted for all the `Operation.Type` options with the exception of `Custom`. To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. {{Xxx}}).

validator.title: The name of the .NET Type that will perform the validation.
validator.description: Defaults to the `Entity.Validator` where not specified explicitly. Only used for `Operation.Type` options `Create` or `Update`.

uniqueKey.title: Indicates whether the properties marked as a unique key (`Property.UniqueKey`) are to be used as the parameters.
uniqueKey.description: This simplifies the specification of these properties versus having to declare each specifically.

paging.title: Indicates whether a `PagingArgs` argument is to be added to the operation to enable (standardized) paging related logic.

valueType.title: The .NET value parameter `Type` for the operation.
valueType.description: Defaults to the parent `Entity.Name` where the `Operation.Type` options are `Create` or `Update`.

returnType.title: The .NET return `Type` for the operation.
returnType.description: Defaults to the parent `Entity.Name` where the `Operation.Type` options are `Get`, `GetColl`, `Create` or `Update`; otherwise, defaults to `void`.

returnTypeNullable.title: Indicates whether the `ReturnType` is nullable for the operation.
returnTypeNullable.description: This is only applicable for an `Operation.Type` of `Custom`. Will be inferred where the `ReturnType` is denoted as nullable; i.e. suffixed by a `?`.

returnText.title: The text for use in comments to describe the `ReturnType`.
returnText.description: A default will be created where not specified. To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. {{Xxx}}).

privateName.title: The overriding private name.
privateName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for private usage. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `GetByArgs` as `_getByArgs`.

autoImplement.title: The operation override for the `Entity.AutoImplement`.
autoImplement.description: Defaults to `Entity.AutoImplement`. The corresponding `Entity.AutoImplement` must be defined for this to be enacted. Auto-implementation is applicable for all `Operation.Type` options with the exception of `Custom`.

dataEntityMapper.title: The override for the data entity `Mapper`.
dataEntityMapper.description: Used where the default generated `Mapper` is not applicable.

databaseStoredProc.title: The database stored procedure name used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Database`.

cosmosContainerId.title: The Cosmos `ContainerId` override used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.

cosmosPartitionKey.title: The C# code override to be used for setting the optional Cosmos `PartitionKey` used where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `Cosmos`.

odataCollectionName.title: The override name of the underlying OData collection where `Operation.AutoImplement` is `OData`.
odataCollectionName.description: Overriddes the `Entity.ODataCollectionName`; otherwise, the underlying `Simple.OData.Client` will attempt to infer.

managerCustom.title: Indicates whether the `Manager` logic is a custom implementation; i.e. no auto-`DataSvc` invocation logic is to be generated.

managerTransaction.title: Indicates whether a `System.TransactionScope` should be created and orchestrated at the `Manager`-layer.

dataSvcCustom.title: Indicates whether the `DataSvc` logic is a custom implementation; i.e. no auto-`DataSvc` invocation logic is to be generated.

dataSvcTransaction.title: Indicates whether a `System.TransactionScope` should be created and orchestrated at the `DataSvc`-layer.

eventPublish.title: Indicates whether to add logic to publish an event on the successful completion of the `DataSvc` layer invocation for a `Create`, `Update` or `Delete` operation.
eventPublish.description: Defaults to the `CodeGeneration.EventPublish` or `Entity.EventPublish` configuration property (inherits) where not specified. Used to enable the sending of messages to the likes of EventGrid, Service Broker, SignalR, etc.

eventSubject.title: The event subject template and corresponding event action pair (separated by a colon).
eventSubject.description: The event subject template defaults to `{AppName}.{Entity.Name}` plus each of the unique key placeholders comma separated; e.g. `Domain.Entity.{id1},{id2}`. The event action defaults to `WebApiOperationType` or `Operation.Type` where not specified. Multiple events can be raised by specifying more than one subject/action pair separated by a semicolon. E.g. `Demo.Person.{id}:Create;Demo.Other.{id}:Update`.

webApiRoute.title: The Web API `RouteAtttribute` to be appended to the `Entity.WebApiRoutePrefix`.

webApiAuthorize.title: The authorize attribute value to be used for the corresponding entity Web API controller; generally either `Authorize` or `AllowAnonymous`.
webApiAuthorize.description: Where not specified no attribute output will occur; it will then inherit as supported by .NET.

webApiMethod.title: The HTTP Method for the operation.
webApiMethod.description: The value defaults as follows: `HttpGet` for `Operation.Type` value `Get` or `GetColl`, `HttpPost` for `Operation.Type` value `Create` or `Custom`, `HttpPut` for `Operation.Type` value `Update`, and `HttpDelete` for `Operation.Type` value `Delete`. An `Operation.Type` value `Patch` can not be specified and will always default to `HttpPatch`.

webApiStatus.title: The primary HTTP Status Code that will be returned for the operation where there is a non-`null` return value.
webApiStatus.description: The value defaults as follows: `OK` for `Operation.Type` value `Get`, `GetColl`, `Update`, `Delete` or `Custom`, `Created` for `Operation.Type` value `Create`.

webApiAlternateStatus.title: The primary HTTP Status Code that will be returned for the operation where there is a `null` return value.
webApiAlternateStatus.description: The value defaults as follows: `NotFound` for `Operation.Type` value `Get`, `NoContent` for `Operation.Type` value `GetColl`, `Create`, `Update` or `Patch`; otherwise, `ThrowException` which will result in an `InvalidOperationException`.

webApiOperationType.title: The `ExecutionContext.OperationType` (CRUD denotation) where the `Operation.Type` is `Custom` (i.e. can not be inferred).
webApiOperationType.description: The default will be inferred where possible; otherwise, set to `Unspecified`.

patchGetOperation.title: The corresponding `Get` method name (in the `XxxManager`) where the `Operation.Type` is `Patch`.
patchGetOperation.description: Defaults to `Get`. Specify either just the method name (e.g. `OperationName`) or, interface and method name (e.g. `IXxxManager.OperationName`) to be invoked where in a different `YyyManager.OperationName`.

patchUpdateOperation.title: The corresponding `Update` method name (in the `XxxManager`) where the `Operation.Type` is `Patch`.
patchUpdateOperation.description: Defaults to `Update`. Specify either just the method name (e.g. `OperationName`) or, interface and method name (e.g. `IXxxManager.OperationName`) to be invoked where in a different `YyyManager.OperationName`.

authPermission.title: The permission used by the `ExecutionContext.IsAuthorized(AuthPermission)` to determine whether the user is authorized.

authRole.title: The permission used by the `ExecutionContext.IsInRole(AuthRole)` to determine whether the user is authorized.

excludeAll.title: The option to exclude the generation of all `Operation` related output.
excludeAll.description: Is a shorthand means for setting all of the other `Exclude*` properties to `true`.

excludeIData.title: The option to exclude the generation of the operation within the `Data` interface (`IXxxData.cs`) output.

excludeData.title: The option to exclude the generation of the operation within the `Data` class (`XxxData.cs`) output.

excludeIDataSvc.title: The option to exclude the generation of the operation within the `DataSvc` interface (`IXxxDataSvc.cs`) output.

excludeDataSvc.title: The option to exclude the generation of the operation within the `DataSvc` class (`XxxDataSvc.cs`) output.

excludeIManager.title: The option to exclude the generation of the operation within the `Manager` interface (`IXxxManager.cs`) output.

excludeManager.title: The option to exclude the generation of the operation within the `Manager` class (`XxxManager.cs`) output.

excludeWebApi.title: The option to exclude the generation of the operation within the WebAPI `Controller` class (`XxxController.cs`) output.

excludeWebApiAgent.title: The option to exclude the generation of the operation within the WebAPI consuming `Agent` class (`XxxAgent.cs`) output.

excludeGrpcAgent.title: The option to exclude the generation of the operation within the gRPC consuming `Agent` class (`XxxAgent.cs`) output.

grpc.title: Indicates whether gRPC support (more specifically service-side) is required for the Operation.
grpc.description: gRPC support is an explicit opt-in model (see `CodeGeneration.Grpc` configuration); therefore, each corresponding `Entity`, `Property` and `Operation` will also need to be opted-in specifically.

text.title: The overriding text for use in comments.
text.description: By default the `Text` will be the `Name` reformatted as sentence casing.

type.title: The .NET `Type`.
type.description: Defaults to `string`. To reference a Reference Data `Type` always prefix with `RefDataNamespace` (e.g. `RefDataNamespace.Gender`). This will ensure that the appropriate Reference Data using statement is used. Shortcut: Where the `Type` starts with (prefix) `RefDataNamespace.` and the correspondong `RefDataType` attribute is not specified it will automatically default the `RefDataType` to `string.`

nullable.title: Indicates whether the .NET `Type should be declared as nullable; e.g. `string?`. Will be inferred where the `Type` is denoted as nullable; i.e. suffixed by a `?`.

default.title: The C# code to default the value.
default.description: Where the `Type` is `string` then the specified default value will need to be delimited. Any valid value assignment C# code can be used.

privateName.title: The overriding private name.
privateName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for private fields. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `_firstName`.

argumentName.title: The overriding argument name.
argumentName.description: Overrides the `Name` to be used for argument parameters. By default reformatted from `Name`; e.g. `FirstName` as `firstName`.

property.title: The `Property.Name` within the parent `Entity` to copy (set) the configuration/characteristics from where not already defined.

refDataType.title: The underlying Reference Data Type that is also used as the Reference Data serialization identifier (SID).
refDataType.description: Defaults to `string` where not specified and the corresponding `Type` starts with (prefix) `RefDataNamespace.`.

refDataList.title: Indicates that the Reference Data property is to be a serializable list (`ReferenceDataSidList`).
refDataList.description: This is required to enable a list of Reference Data values (as per `RefDataType`) to be passed as an argument for example.

validator.title: The name of the .NET `Type` that will perform the validation.

validatorCode.title: The fluent-style method-chaining C# validator code to append to `IsMandatory` and `Validator` (where specified).

isMandatory.title: Indicates whether a `ValidationException` should be thrown when the parameter value has its default value (null, zero, etc).

layerPassing.title: The option that determines the layers in which the parameter is passed.
layerPassing.description: Defaults to `All`. To further describe, `All` passes the parameter through all layeys, `ToManagerSet` only passes the parameter to the `Manager` layer and overrides the same named property within the corresponding `value` parameter, `ToManagerCollSet` only passes the parameter to the `Manager` layer and overrides the same named property within the corresponding `value` collection parameter. Where using the `UniqueKey` option to automatically set `Parameters`, and the `Operation.Type` is `Create` or `Update` it will default to `ToManagerSet`.

dataConverter.title: The data `Converter` class name where specific data conversion is required.
dataConverter.description: A `Converter` is used to convert a data source value to/from a .NET `Type` where the standard data type conversion is not applicable.

dataConverterIsGeneric.title: Indicates whether the data `Converter` is a generic class and will automatically use the corresponding property `Type` as the generic `T`.

webApiFrom.title: The option for how the parameter will be delcared within the Web API Controller.
webApiFrom.description: Defaults to `FromQuery`; unless the parameter `Type` has also been defined as an `Entity` within the code-gen config file then it will default to `FromEntityProperties`. Specifies that the parameter will be declared with corresponding `FromQueryAttribute`, `FromBodyAttribute` or `FromRouteAttribute` for the Web API method. The `FromEntityProperties` will declare all properties of the `Entity` as query parameters.

grpcType.title: The underlying gRPC data type; will be inferred where not specified.

value.title: The .NET (C#) code for the constant value.
value.description: The code generation will ensure the value is delimited properly to output correctly formed (delimited) .NET (C#) code.

text.title: The overriding text for use in comments.
text.description: By default the `Text` will be the `Name` reformatted as sentence casing. It will be formatted as: `Represents a {text} constant value.` To create a `<see cref="XXX"/>` within use moustache shorthand (e.g. `{{Xxx}}`).
